title: Deep calibration with random grids. (arXiv:2306.11061v1 [q-fin.PR])
abstract: We propose a neural network-based approach to calibrating stochastic volatility models, which combines the pioneering grid approach by Horvath et al. (2021) with the pointwise two-stage calibration of Bayer and Stemper (2018). Our methodology inherits robustness from the former while not suffering from the need for interpolation/extrapolation techniques, a clear advantage ensured by the pointwise approach. The crucial point to the entire procedure is the generation of implied volatility surfaces on random grids, which one dispenses to the network in the training phase. We support the validity of our calibration technique with several empirical and Monte Carlo experiments for the rough Bergomi and Heston models under a simple but effective parametrization of the forward variance curve. The approach paves the way for valuable applications in financial engineering - for instance, pricing under local stochastic volatility models - and extensions to the fast-growing field of path-dependent

translated_title: 随机网格的深度校准方法
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种基于神经网络的随机波动率模型校准方法，该方法将Horvath等人（2021）的网格方法与Bayer和Stemper（2018）的点对点两步校准相结合。我们的方法继承了前者的鲁棒性，而不会受到插值/外推技术的需要所困扰，这是点对点方法的明显优势。整个程序的关键在于在随机格上生成含隐含波动率面，将其在训练阶段提供给网络。我们通过对粗糙Bergomi和Heston模型进行几个经验和蒙特卡罗实验来支持我们的校准技术的有效性，这些实验采用了简单而有效的正向方差曲线参数化。该方法为金融工程学中的有价值的应用（例如，在本地随机波动率模型下的定价）以及路径相关领域的快速扩展铺平了道路。
tldr: 本文提出一种基于神经网络的随机波动率模型校准方法，在不需要插值/外推技术的情况下结合了网格方法和点对点两步校准。我们通过在随机格上生成含隐含波动率面，并将其在训练阶段提供给网络，证明了该方法在金融工程学中有着有价值的应用。
